segment.source: Getting Started - Using MBAM with Configuration Manager
segment.target: Getting Started - Using MBAM with Configuration Manager

segment.source: Getting Started - Using MBAM with Configuration Manager
segment.target: Getting Started - Using MBAM with Configuration Manager

segment.source: Getting Started - Using MBAM with Configuration Manager
segment.target: Getting Started - Using MBAM with Configuration Manager

segment.source: When you install Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM), you can choose a topology that integrates MBAM with Configuration Manager 2007 or System Center 2012 Configuration Manager.
segment.target: When you install Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM), you can choose a topology that integrates MBAM with Configuration Manager 2007 or System Center 2012 Configuration Manager.

segment.source: For a list of the supported versions of Configuration Manager that MBAM supports, see Planning to Deploy MBAM with Configuration Manager.
segment.target: For a list of the supported versions of Configuration Manager that MBAM supports, see Planning to Deploy MBAM with Configuration Manager.

segment.source: In the integrated topology, the hardware compliance and reporting features are removed from MBAM and are accessed from Configuration Manager.
segment.target: In the integrated topology, the hardware compliance and reporting features are removed from MBAM and are accessed from Configuration Manager.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Windows To Go is not supported when you install the integrated topology of MBAM with Configuration Manager 2007.
segment.target: Windows To Go is not supported when you install the integrated topology of MBAM with Configuration Manager 2007.

segment.source: Using MBAM with Configuration Manager
segment.target: Using MBAM with Configuration Manager

segment.source: The integration of MBAM is based on a new Configuration Pack that installs the following three items into Configuration Manager 2007 or System Center 2012 Configuration Manager, which are described in detail in the following sections:
segment.target: The integration of MBAM is based on a new Configuration Pack that installs the following three items into Configuration Manager 2007 or System Center 2012 Configuration Manager, which are described in detail in the following sections:

segment.source: Configuration data that consists of configuration items and a configuration baseline
segment.target: Configuration data that consists of configuration items and a configuration baseline

segment.source: Collection
segment.target: Collection

segment.source: Reports
segment.target: Reports

segment.source: Configuration Data
segment.target: Configuration Data

segment.source: The configuration data installs a configuration baseline, called “BitLocker Protection,” which contains two configuration items: “BitLocker Operating System Drive Protection” and “BitLocker Fixed Data Drives Protection.”
segment.target: The configuration data installs a configuration baseline, called “BitLocker Protection,” which contains two configuration items: “BitLocker Operating System Drive Protection” and “BitLocker Fixed Data Drives Protection.”

segment.source: The configuration baseline is deployed to the collection, which is also created when MBAM is installed.
segment.target: The configuration baseline is deployed to the collection, which is also created when MBAM is installed.

segment.source: The two configuration items provide the basis for evaluating the compliance status of the client computers.
segment.target: The two configuration items provide the basis for evaluating the compliance status of the client computers.

segment.source: This information is captured, stored, and evaluated in Configuration Manager.
segment.target: This information is captured, stored, and evaluated in Configuration Manager.

segment.source: The configuration items are based on the compliance requirements for operating system drives (OSDs) and Fixed Data Drives (FDDs).
segment.target: The configuration items are based on the compliance requirements for operating system drives (OSDs) and Fixed Data Drives (FDDs).

segment.source: The required details for the deployed computers are collected so that the compliance for those drive types can be evaluated.
segment.target: The required details for the deployed computers are collected so that the compliance for those drive types can be evaluated.

segment.source: By default, the configuration baseline evaluates the compliance status every 12 hours and sends the compliance data to Configuration Manager.
segment.target: By default, the configuration baseline evaluates the compliance status every 12 hours and sends the compliance data to Configuration Manager.

segment.source: Collection
segment.target: Collection

segment.source: MBAM creates a collection that is called MBAM Supported Computers.
segment.target: MBAM creates a collection that is called MBAM Supported Computers.

segment.source: The configuration baseline is targeted to client computers that are in this collection.
segment.target: The configuration baseline is targeted to client computers that are in this collection.

segment.source: This is a dynamic collection that, by default, runs every 12 hours and evaluates membership.
segment.target: This is a dynamic collection that, by default, runs every 12 hours and evaluates membership.

segment.source: Membership is based on three criteria:
segment.target: Membership is based on three criteria:

segment.source: It is a supported version of the Windows operating system.
segment.target: It is a supported version of the Windows operating system.

segment.source: Currently, MBAM supports only Windows 7 Enterprise and Windows 7 Ultimate, Windows 8 Enterprise, and Windows To Go, when Windows To Go is running on Windows 8 Enterprise.
segment.target: Currently, MBAM supports only Windows 7 Enterprise and Windows 7 Ultimate, Windows 8 Enterprise, and Windows To Go, when Windows To Go is running on Windows 8 Enterprise.

segment.source: It is a physical computer.
segment.target: It is a physical computer.

segment.source: Virtual machines are not supported.
segment.target: Virtual machines are not supported.

segment.source: Trusted Platform Module (TPM) is available.
segment.target: Trusted Platform Module (TPM) is available.

segment.source: A compatible version of TPM 1.2 or later is required for Windows 7.
segment.target: A compatible version of TPM 1.2 or later is required for Windows 7.

segment.source: Windows 8 and Windows To Go do not require a TPM.
segment.target: Windows 8 and Windows To Go do not require a TPM.

segment.source: The collection is evaluated against all computers and creates the subset of compatible computers that provides the basis for compliance evaluation and reporting for the MBAM integration.
segment.target: The collection is evaluated against all computers and creates the subset of compatible computers that provides the basis for compliance evaluation and reporting for the MBAM integration.

segment.source: Reports
segment.target: Reports

segment.source: There are four reports that you can use to view compliance.
segment.target: There are four reports that you can use to view compliance.

segment.source: They are:
segment.target: They are:

segment.source: BitLocker Enterprise Compliance Dashboard – gives IT administrators three different views of information on a single report: Compliance Status Distribution, Non Compliant – Errors Distribution, and Compliance Status Distribution By Drive Type.
segment.target: BitLocker Enterprise Compliance Dashboard – gives IT administrators three different views of information on a single report: Compliance Status Distribution, Non Compliant – Errors Distribution, and Compliance Status Distribution By Drive Type.

segment.source: Drill-down options on the report let IT administrators click through the data and view a list of computers that match the state that you select.
segment.target: Drill-down options on the report let IT administrators click through the data and view a list of computers that match the state that you select.

segment.source: BitLocker Enterprise Compliance Details – lets IT administrators view information about the BitLocker encryption compliance status of the enterprise and includes the compliance status for each computer.
segment.target: BitLocker Enterprise Compliance Details – lets IT administrators view information about the BitLocker encryption compliance status of the enterprise and includes the compliance status for each computer.

segment.source: Drill-down options on the report let IT administrators click through the data and view a list of computers that match the state that you select.
segment.target: Drill-down options on the report let IT administrators click through the data and view a list of computers that match the state that you select.

segment.source: BitLocker Computer Compliance – lets IT administrators view an individual computer and determine why it was reported with a given status of compliant or not compliant.
segment.target: BitLocker Computer Compliance – lets IT administrators view an individual computer and determine why it was reported with a given status of compliant or not compliant.

segment.source: The report also displays the encryption state of the operating system drives (OSD) and fixed data drives (FDDs).
segment.target: The report also displays the encryption state of the operating system drives (OSD) and fixed data drives (FDDs).

segment.source: BitLocker Enterprise Compliance Summary – lets IT administrators view the status of the compliance of the enterprise with MBAM policy.
segment.target: BitLocker Enterprise Compliance Summary – lets IT administrators view the status of the compliance of the enterprise with MBAM policy.

segment.source: Each computer’s state is evaluated, and the report shows a summary of the compliance of all computers in the enterprise against the policy.
segment.target: Each computer’s state is evaluated, and the report shows a summary of the compliance of all computers in the enterprise against the policy.

segment.source: Drill-down options on the report let IT administrators click through the data and view a list of computers that match the state that you select.
segment.target: Drill-down options on the report let IT administrators click through the data and view a list of computers that match the state that you select.

segment.source: High-Level Architecture of MBAM with Configuration Manager
segment.target: High-Level Architecture of MBAM with Configuration Manager

segment.source: The following image shows the MBAM architecture with the Configuration Manager topology.
segment.target: The following image shows the MBAM architecture with the Configuration Manager topology.

segment.source: This configuration supports up to 200,000 MBAM clients in a production environment.
segment.target: This configuration supports up to 200,000 MBAM clients in a production environment.

segment.source: mbam architecture with configuration manager
segment.target: mbam architecture with configuration manager

segment.source: A description of the servers, databases, and features of this architecture follows.
segment.target: A description of the servers, databases, and features of this architecture follows.

segment.source: The server features and databases in the architecture image are listed under the computer or server where we recommend that you install them.
segment.target: The server features and databases in the architecture image are listed under the computer or server where we recommend that you install them.

segment.source: Database Server – The Recovery Database, Audit Database, and Audit Reports are installed on a Windows server and supported SQL Server instance.
segment.target: Database Server – The Recovery Database, Audit Database, and Audit Reports are installed on a Windows server and supported SQL Server instance.

segment.source: The Recovery database stores recovery data that is collected from MBAM client computers.
segment.target: The Recovery database stores recovery data that is collected from MBAM client computers.

segment.source: The Audit Database stores audit activity data that is collected from client computers that have accessed recovery data.
segment.target: The Audit Database stores audit activity data that is collected from client computers that have accessed recovery data.

segment.source: The Audit Reports provide data about the compliance status of client computers in your enterprise.
segment.target: The Audit Reports provide data about the compliance status of client computers in your enterprise.

segment.source: Configuration Manager Primary Site Server – The Configuration Manager Server contains of the MBAM server installation with the System Center Configuration Manager Integration topology, which must be installed on a Configuration Manager primary site server.
segment.target: Configuration Manager Primary Site Server – The Configuration Manager Server contains of the MBAM server installation with the System Center Configuration Manager Integration topology, which must be installed on a Configuration Manager primary site server.

segment.source: The Configuration Manager Server collects the hardware inventory information from client computers and is used to report BitLocker compliance of client computers.
segment.target: The Configuration Manager Server collects the hardware inventory information from client computers and is used to report BitLocker compliance of client computers.

segment.source: When you run the MBAM Setup server installation, a collection and the configuration data are installed on the Configuration Manager Primary Site Server.
segment.target: When you run the MBAM Setup server installation, a collection and the configuration data are installed on the Configuration Manager Primary Site Server.

segment.source: Administration and Monitoring Server - The Administration and Monitoring Server is installed on a Windows server and consists of the Administration and Monitoring website and the monitoring web services.
segment.target: Administration and Monitoring Server - The Administration and Monitoring Server is installed on a Windows server and consists of the Administration and Monitoring website and the monitoring web services.

segment.source: The Administration and Monitoring website is used to audit activity and to access recovery data (for example, BitLocker recovery keys).
segment.target: The Administration and Monitoring website is used to audit activity and to access recovery data (for example, BitLocker recovery keys).

segment.source: The Self-Service Portal is also installed on the Administration and Monitoring Server.
segment.target: The Self-Service Portal is also installed on the Administration and Monitoring Server.

segment.source: The Portal enables end users on client computers to independently log onto a website to get a recovery key if they lose or forget their BitLocker password.
segment.target: The Portal enables end users on client computers to independently log onto a website to get a recovery key if they lose or forget their BitLocker password.

segment.source: The Audit reports are also installed on the Administration and Monitoring Server.
segment.target: The Audit reports are also installed on the Administration and Monitoring Server.

segment.source: Management Workstation - The Policy Template consists of Group Policy Objects that define MBAM implementation settings for BitLocker drive encryption.
segment.target: Management Workstation - The Policy Template consists of Group Policy Objects that define MBAM implementation settings for BitLocker drive encryption.

segment.source: You can install the Policy template on any server or workstation, but it is commonly installed on a management workstation that is a supported Windows server or client computer.
segment.target: You can install the Policy template on any server or workstation, but it is commonly installed on a management workstation that is a supported Windows server or client computer.

segment.source: The workstation does not have to be a dedicated computer.
segment.target: The workstation does not have to be a dedicated computer.

segment.source: MBAM Client and Configuration Manager Client computer
segment.target: MBAM Client and Configuration Manager Client computer

segment.source: The MBAM Client performs the following tasks:
segment.target: The MBAM Client performs the following tasks:

segment.source: Uses Group Policy Objects to enforce the BitLocker encryption of client computers in the enterprise.
segment.target: Uses Group Policy Objects to enforce the BitLocker encryption of client computers in the enterprise.

segment.source: Collects the recovery key for the three BitLocker data drive types: operating system drives, fixed data drives, and removable data (USB) drives.
segment.target: Collects the recovery key for the three BitLocker data drive types: operating system drives, fixed data drives, and removable data (USB) drives.

segment.source: Collects recovery information and computer information about the client computers.
segment.target: Collects recovery information and computer information about the client computers.

segment.source: Configuration Manager Client – The Configuration Manager client enables Configuration Manager to collect hardware compatibility data about the client computers, and enables Configuration Manager to report compliance information.
segment.target: Configuration Manager Client – The Configuration Manager client enables Configuration Manager to collect hardware compatibility data about the client computers, and enables Configuration Manager to report compliance information.

segment.target: Related topics
